SEARCH
Module comp3111.examsystem
Package comp3111.examsystem

Class Course

java.lang.Object
comp3111.examsystem.Course
public class Course extends Object
Represents a Course which has an ID, name, department, a list of students, and exams. The class manages relationships between courses, teachers, and students.

    • Course

      public Course(String courseID, String name, String department, Teacher teacher, ArrayList<Student> students, ArrayList<Exam> exams)
      Constructs a Course with all attributes including teacher.
      Parameters:
      courseID - The ID of the course.
      name - The name of the course.
      department - The department offering the course.
      teacher - A Teacher object representing the instructor of the course.
      students - A list of Student objects enrolled in the course.
      exams - A list of Exam objects associated with the course.

    • Course

      name - The name of the course.
      department - The department offering the course.
      students - A list of Student objects enrolled in the course.
      exams - A list of Exam objects associated with the course.

    • Course

      public Course(String courseID, String name, String department)
      Constructs a new Course object with the specified ID, name, and department. Initializes lists to hold student usernames and exams associated with this course.
      Parameters:
      courseID - The unique identifier for the course.
      name - The name of the course.
      department - The department offering the course.

  • Method Details

    • getCourseName

      public String getCourseName()
      Retrieves the name of the course.
      Returns:
      The name of the course.

    • getCourseID

      public String getCourseID()
      Retrieves the ID of the course.
      Returns:
      The ID of the course.

    • getDepartment

      public String getDepartment()
      Retrieves the department offering the course.
      Returns:
      The department offering the course.

    • setDepartment

      public void setDepartment(String department)
      Updates the department of the course and notifies the database.
      Parameters:
      department - The new department for the course.

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Updates the name of the course and notifies the database.
      Parameters:
      name - The new name for the course.

    • addStudent

      public void addStudent(Student student)
      Adds a student to the course if they are not already enrolled, establishes bidirectional relationship, initializes their grades, and updates the database.
      Parameters:
      student - The Student object to be added.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the student is already enrolled in the course.

    • getStudents

      public List<Student> getStudents()
      Retrieves a list of all students enrolled in the course.
      Returns:
      A List containing Student objects representing all students currently enrolled in the course.

    • dropStudent

      public void dropStudent(Student student)
      Removes a student from the course if they are enrolled, breaks the bidirectional relationship with the Student object, removes their grades, and updates the database.
      Parameters:
      student - The Student object to be removed.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If no such student is found in the course.

    • setTeacher

      public void setTeacher(Teacher teacher)
      Assigns a teacher to the course. If an existing teacher is already assigned, they are removed from this course before assigning the new one. Updates the database after any changes.
      Parameters:
      teacher - The Teacher object to be assigned, or null if no teacher should be assigned.

    • getTeacher

      public Teacher getTeacher()
      Retrieves the Teacher assigned to the course.
      Returns:
      The Teacher object if a teacher is assigned; otherwise, null.

    • addExam

      public void addExam(Exam exam)
      Adds an Exam to the course. Ensures that the exam belongs to this course, and that no other exam with the same name exists in this course. Initializes grades for all students related to this new exam. Updates the database after adding the exam.
      Parameters:
      exam - The Exam object to be added.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the exam does not belong to this course or if an exam with the same name already exists.

    • updateExam

      public void updateExam(String examName, Exam exam)
      Updates an existing exam within the course. If the new Exam object is provided, it replaces the old one with the same name and may change the associated course.
      Parameters:
      examName - The name of the exam to be updated.
      exam - The new Exam object that will replace the existing one, or null if updating without a new instance.

    • dropExam

      public void dropExam(Exam exam)
      Drops an exam from the course by Exam object.
      Parameters:
      exam - The Exam object to be removed.

    • dropExam

      public void dropExam(String examName)
      Removes an Exam from the course by its name. Deletes the associated grades for all students in this course, and updates the database after removal.
      Parameters:
      examName - The name of the Exam to be removed.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If no such exam exists within the course.

    • getExams

      public ArrayList<Exam> getExams()
      Retrieves all exams associated with this course.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of Exam objects representing the exams in this course.

    • update

      public Course update(String courseID, String name, String department)
      Updates the details of the course, such as its ID, name, and department, and returns the updated Course object for method chaining if necessary.
      Parameters:
      courseID - The new unique identifier for the course.
      name - The new name of the course.
      department - The new department offering the course.
      Returns:
      This Course object after updating its details.

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Overrides:
